publicationStmt.p: This document forms part of the project "Editing the Earth M.M. White Collection" at the University of North Florida.

msIdentifier.repository: University of North Florida, Thomas G. Carpenter Library Special Collections and Archives

msContents.summary: Author writes to White about American Humane Education Society literature.

objectDesc.p: A single page handwritten letter from Yarrow to White dated 5/1/1929 with writing on both sides of the paper. The letter has Yarrow's personal haeding and is stamped with the dates of American Humane Education society events in 1929. It is accompanied by a handwritten list of literature being sent to White and the letter's envelope with White's street address and American Humane Education Society stamps.

div.p:
A Plea for the Horse
Every horse will work better and longer if
given three ample meals daily; plenty of
clean, fresh water; proper shoes, sharpened
in slippery weather; a blanket in cold
weather; a stall 6 x 9, or enough room to
lie down; a fly net in summer; two weeks'
vacation each year. Do not use the cruel,
tight-check rein, or closely-fitting blinders,
which cause blindness.
Spare the Whip

Empty milk bottles should be cleansed promptly as kittens crawl into
them for a few drops of milk, cannot get out, and die of suffocation.
